RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject

RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject Class Reference

#include <consoleobject.h>

Inheritance diagram for RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

The Console to Object wrapper.

To provides the console access to Instance of classes, we use a ConsoleObject for each class. All the ConsoleObject must be a subclass of this. To provides a ConsoleObject access in the console the name property is used. A property called desc (for description) is used in the console to provides a brief help on each object.

The most important use of the console objects is their typed attributes. Each ConsoleObject has a vector of ObjectAttribute.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject::ConsoleObject ( char *  name  ) 

A Constuctor withn the ConsoleObject name.

The name of object is used in the console as an identifier. This constructor use the setName( char* name) method.The description property is set to an empty string. Use setDesc( char* desc) to define a new description string.

Parameters:
name The name string

void RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject::setDesc ( char *  desc  ) 

Change the description string of the object.

The method does not control the value of the parameter.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject::setName ( char *  name  ) 

Change the name.

If the name passed as parameter is NULL (empty), the Logger received a error log message.

Parameters:
name The new name of the object

Member Data Documentation

tAttrbList RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject::attrbList [protected]

The list of the Object's attributes.

A console object can have some typed attributes. They are stored in a stl vector of ObjectAttribute.

char* RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject::desc [private]

A description of the object.

The description will be shown with the name with the show command

char* RainbruRPG::Exception::ConsoleObject::name [private]

The name of the object.

This name can't be null. It's the name we use in the console to access its attributes.
